meanings.definition: The quality or state of being inheritable.
meanings.sent1: The inheritabilities of the trait were evident in the family tree.
meanings.sent2: Inheritabilities play a crucial role in determining genetic traits.
meanings.sent3: The party was full of inheritabilities, with everyone resembling their grandparents.
meanings.sent4: The inheritabilities of intelligence can be seen in the siblings' academic achievements.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the inheritabilities of diseases can help in preventive healthcare.

meanings.definition: The ability to be passed down from one generation to the next.
meanings.sent1: He was proud of the inheritabilities of his family's traditions.
meanings.sent2: Inheritabilities ensure the continuation of cultural practices.
meanings.sent3: The inheritabilities of storytelling in the family made gatherings entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The inheritabilities of skills are cherished as family legacies.
meanings.sent5: The inheritabilities of resilience helped the family overcome challenges.
